author: Associated Press
title: Colorado Avalanche beats slumping Ducks 3-0
text: Reto Berra's shutout sends Colorado past slumping Ducks 3-0 Associated Press 10:32 AM, Oct 17, 2015 4 hours ago colorado avalanche | sports | hockey | anaheim ducks ANAHEIM, CA - OCTOBER 16: Nathan MacKinnon #29 of the Colorado Avalanche, Gabriel Landeskog #92 of the Colorado Avalanche, Alex Tanguay #40 of the Colorado Avalanche, Ryan Kesler #17 of the Anaheim DucRyan Kesler #17 of the Anaheim Ducks and Andrew Cogliano #7 of the Anaheim Ducks scramble for a loose puck during the third period of a game at Honda Center on October 16, 2015 in Anaheim, California. Show Caption Previous Next Reto Berra made 35 saves for his second career shutout and Nathan MacKinnon scored in the opening minute of the Colorado Avalanche's 3-0 victory over the winless Anaheim Ducks on Friday night. Jack Skille also scored for the Avalanche, who dominated their road opener against the three-time defending Pacific Division champions. The Ducks fell to 0-3-1 with just one goal all season. Berra became the third goalie to shut out the Ducks this season, making several big saves. It was the Swiss netminder's 52nd NHL game. Frederik Andersen stopped 22 shots for the Ducks, who haven't scored in more than 163 minutes since Sami Vatanen got their only goal against Vancouver on Monday. Anaheim finished one game short of the Stanley Cup Final last season.
